title: Daily vaccination numbers drop to 50
body_lines: Only 50 persons were vaccinated against COVID-19 on Sunday, with 36 persons receiving the booster dose.
The booster dose has been administered to a total of 7,966,599 persons.
According to the Epidemiology Unit, 17,063,898 persons have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine and 14,456,291 persons have received the second dose as well.

On Sunday, six persons received the first dose of Pfizer, raising the total number of persons to have received the first dose of the vaccine to 2,571,672. The second dose of the vaccine has been administered to 915,635 persons. This includes eight persons vaccinated on Sunday.

The Epidemiology Unit states that 12,048,690 persons have received the first dose of Sinopharm and 11,178,898 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine. The first dose of AstraZeneca has been administered to 1,479,631 persons, out of which 1,418,593 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
The first dose of Moderna has been administered to 804,801 persons and the second dose has been administered to 787,361 persons.
A total of 159,110 persons have received the first dose of Sputnik V and 155,812 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
